title: Cache poisoning via X-Forwarded-Host in www.shopify.com/partners/blog

profile.name: Shopify
profile.about: Shopify is a multi-channel commerce platform that helps people sell online, in-store, and everywhere in between.

vulnerability_information_html:
Hello, run in loop requests withX-Forwarded-Host: your_hackerz_site.com - after some time You will notice in response your_hackerz_site.com

now remove X-Forwarded-Host - there still be our url:

i've logged to my VPS to verify this bug and downloaded poisoned page (https://www.shopify.com/partners/blog/7-web-design-and-development-awards-you-should-enter) , it's contains links to collabolator:

Looks like there is no URL keys so i stopped testing cause i'm breaking site functionally, but it was be worth to check if we can poison X-Forwarded-Host : foobar.pl"><img src=x onerror=blah> or try use other headers, if i get permission i can try other vectors on a older article to prevent distributing users.

Impact

poisoning links, eg. FB share button:

https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fa4129912adehq5m14ryflu01ovx68j0ur0ho6.burpcollaborator.net%2Fpartners%2Fblog%2F7-web-design-and-development-awards-you-should-enter

weakness.name: Improper Neutralization of HTTP Headers for Scripting Syntax

activities.message:
Now see that other urls outside ``` /partners/blog ``` are vulnerable too, like:
https://www.shopify.com/amazon
activities.markdown_message:
Now see that other urls outside /partners/blog are vulnerable too, like:
https://www.shopify.com/amazon

activities.message:
Hi @dakitu,

Thank you for the report. When making a request to the blog article above, I do not see my Burp collaborator URL reflected in the response, either using `X-Forwarded-Host` as described in the content of your report or `X-ForwaxxxxxX-Host` as is shown in your screenshot. Were there any additional steps you had to take to reproduce this behaviour? When you say run the request "in a loop", were you running it and then separately visiting the URL to observe this behaviour?
activities.markdown_message:
Hi @dakitu,

Thank you for the report. When making a request to the blog article above, I do not see my Burp collaborator URL reflected in the response, either using X-Forwarded-Host as described in the content of your report or X-ForwaxxxxxX-Host as is shown in your screenshot. Were there any additional steps you had to take to reproduce this behaviour? When you say run the request "in a loop", were you running it and then separately visiting the URL to observe this behaviour?

Ahh! I added wrong screenshot on 1 step:


Looks like You need luck to hit cache, simple run request with X-Forwarded-host: foobar.pl in Burp Intruder or curl loop for 10-20 mins, You finally see foobar.pl in response that will be cached, i can proof ssh credentials to verify that i've downloaded poisoned page and got burpcollab in body.

activities.message: can You wget https://www.shopify.com/partners/blog/7-web-design-and-development-awards-you-should-enter now and confirm that it's count burpcollab?
activities.markdown_message: can You wget https://www.shopify.com/partners/blog/7-web-design-and-development-awards-you-should-enter now and confirm that it's count burpcollab?

activities.message:
You can add this header in any request in Burp Suite in Proxy -> Options like this (empty Match):
{F981888}

and simple browser between blogs posts, later click Burp -> Search and try to find your X-Forwarded-Host value 

btw. i got some hits in collaborator from IP's:
95.168.161.205
94.75.250.83

{F981891}
activities.markdown_message:

activities.message:
Hey @dakitu,

Thank you for the extra information! We were able to reproduce the behaviour you are describing and will let you know as soon as we have an update.
activities.markdown_message:
Hey @dakitu,

Thank you for the extra information! We were able to reproduce the behaviour you are describing and will let you know as soon as we have an update.

activities.message: Second time when i "defaced" www.shopify.com  (see report #902786) xD
activities.markdown_message: Second time when i "defaced" www.shopify.com (see report #902786) xD

activities.message: btw. i believe there can be other "vulnerable" headers but it will be hard to find something because i did not find cache buster and sending ``` thousands random headers * cache-time ``` will take maybe week ;-)
activities.markdown_message: btw. i believe there can be other "vulnerable" headers but it will be hard to find something because i did not find cache buster and sending thousands random headers * cache-time will take maybe week ;-)

activities.message:
Hi @dakitu,

Thank you for your report. We have reproduced the issue and we are working on a fix.
activities.markdown_message:
Hi @dakitu,

Thank you for your report. We have reproduced the issue and we are working on a fix.

activities.message:
Hi @dakitu,

Thanks again for your report. We recently deployed a fix for this issue and it should no longer be reproducible. We'll be in touch soon with a bounty decision.
activities.markdown_message:
Hi @dakitu,

Thanks again for your report. We recently deployed a fix for this issue and it should no longer be reproducible. We'll be in touch soon with a bounty decision.

activities.message:
Hi @dakitu,

Thanks again for your report.

Though the behaviour described does not fall under any of our eligible vulnerability types and bounties for shopify.com are decided on a case-by-case basis, the ability to modify cached pages on shopify.com was deemed severe enough to merit an exception. For this reason, we are awarding a $1,000 bounty for this issue.
activities.markdown_message:
Hi @dakitu,

Thanks again for your report.

Though the behaviour described does not fall under any of our eligible vulnerability types and bounties for shopify.com are decided on a case-by-case basis, the ability to modify cached pages on shopify.com was deemed severe enough to merit an exception. For this reason, we are awarding a $1,000 bounty for this issue.
